member.name: M:KeepCoding.ArrayHelper.BinarySearch(System.Array,System.Object)
member.summary: Searches an entire one-dimensional sorted array for a specific element, using the interface implemented by each element of the array and by the specified object.
member.param: The sorted one-dimensional Array to search.
The object to search for.
member.returns: The index of the specified in the specified , if is found; otherwise, a negative number. If is not found and is less than one or more elements in , the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of the index of the first element that is larger than . If is not found and is greater than all elements in , the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of (the index of the last element plus 1). If this method is called with a non-sorted , the return can be incorrect and a negative number could be returned, even if is present in .

member.name: T:KeepCoding.EventHelper
member.summary: KMFramework extension methods that makes it easier to assign multiple events to a variable in one statement. Written by Emik.
Assigns events specified into . Reassigning them will replace their values. The number passed into each method represents the index that came from the array.
member.remarks: An event that is null will be skipped. This extension method simplifies all of the KMFramework events into Actions.
member.param: The array to add events to.
True will make it act as a module/submodule, and false as a button. Null (default) will set it to true or false based on . Note that in VR, and are skipped out on.
Called when player backs out of this selectable.
Called when a different selectable becomes the focus, or the module has been backed out of.
Called when the selectable stops being the current selectable.
Called when a module is focused, this is when it is interacted with from the bomb face level and its children can be selected.
Called when the highlight is turned on.
Called when the highlight is turned off.
Called when player interacts with the selctable.
Called when a player interacting with the selectable releases the mouse or controller button.
Called when the left controller stick is pulled while selected.
Called when the right controller stick is pulled while selected.
Called whenever the selectable becomes the current selectable.

member.name: T:KeepCoding.ITP
member.summary: Interface for Twitch Plays support. Written by Emik.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.IsTimeSkippable
member.value: Determines if it should allow for the timer to be skipped when the module it is in, as well as any other modules that would like to skip time, are the only unsolved modules left on the bomb.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.IsCancelCommand
member.value: Determines if it should cancel command processing. If this returns true, then stop processing the command, clean up, then do a yield return Cancelled; to acknowledge the cancel.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.IsTimeMode
member.value: Determines if it is in Time Mode, where solves change the timer. This is useful for modules that use the timer's value.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.IsTP
member.value: Determines if Twitch Plays is currently active. This is for modules that need to display different items, or use different rules if Twitch Plays is active.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.IsZenMode
member.value: Determines if the timer is counting up instead of down, for special cases, such as controlling how to sort button release times, or whether there is a low timer event or not.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.ITP.AbandonModule
member.value: Declaring this field allows for Twitch Plays to inform the module that the bomb is in Time Mode, where solves change the timer. This is useful for modules that use the timer's value.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ITP.ProcessTwitchCommand(System.String)
member.summary: When a command is typed into Twitch Plays with the Id of this module, it calls this method and passes in the exact command typed.
member.remarks: Anything that gets yield returned will be processed by Twitch Plays. This includes other methods, , an of , , true, or null.
member.param: The user's command.
member.returns: A series of instructions for the Twitch Plays mod to handle as requested by the user.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.ITP.TwitchHandleForcedSolve
member.summary: When the module runs into an exception or the module is forced to be solved, it calls this method.
member.remarks: Make sure that the module is solved before this method closes, otherwise it causes a forced-solve.
member.returns: A series of instructions for the Twitch Plays mod to handle in order to guarantee a solve.

member.name: T:KeepCoding.TPScript`1
member.summary: Base class for TwitchPlays support for solvable and needy modded modules in Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes. Written by Emik.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.TwitchHelpMessage
member.summary: The help message that gets sent when typing !{0} help.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.IsTimeSkippable
member.value: Determines if it should allow for the timer to be skipped when the module it is in, as well as any other modules that would like to skip time, are the only unsolved modules left on the bomb.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.IsCancelCommand
member.value: Determines if it should cancel command processing. If this returns true, then stop processing the command, clean up, then do a yield return Cancelled; to acknowledge the cancel.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.IsTimeMode
member.value: Determines if it is in Time Mode, where solves change the timer. This is useful for modules that use the timer's value.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.IsTP
member.value: Determines if Twitch Plays is currently active. This is for modules that need to display different items, or use different rules if Twitch Plays is active.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.IsZenMode
member.value: Determines if the timer is counting up instead of down, for special cases, such as controlling how to sort button release times, or whether there is a low timer event or not.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.AbandonModule
member.value: This list contains modules that it should stop processing. Currently, the only module that uses this capability is Souvenir.
member.remarks: These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or or later.

member.name: P:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Module
member.value: The instance of the module.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Strike
member.value: Yield return this to indicate that this command will cause a strike at some later point; all this does is tell Twitch Plays to attribute the strike to the author of this command.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Solve
member.value: Yield return this to indicate that this command will solve the module at some later point; all this does is tell Twitch Plays to attribute the solve to the author of this command.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.UnsubmittablePenalty
member.value: Yield return this to indicate that the command couldn't submit an answer and should only be used to prevent users from guessing the answer. This should not be used if an answer could never be submittable for a module.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.TryCancelSequence
member.value: Yield return this to indicate that the KMSelectable[] sequence that follows this command should be cancelled if a "!cancel" or "!stop" is issued mid-way through that sequence.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Cancelled
member.value: Yield return this to indicate that you have stopped processing the command in response to the bool being set to true.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.MultipleStrikes
member.value: Yield return this to indicate that the issued command is going to cause more than one strike, so should disable the internal strike tracker in order to avoid flooding the chat with "VoteNay Module {id} got a strike! +1 strike to {Nickname}" for as many strikes as will be awarded. This also disables the internal solve tracker as well. This allows for sending additional messages or continue processing commands regardless of the solve/strike state.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.EndMultipleStrikes
member.value: Yield return this to indicate that the strike tracker should be enabled. If any strikes were issued during the time it was disabled, they will be awarded and the routine stopped at that point, otherwise, it will just cancel the "VoteNay Module {id} got 0 strikes! +0 strike to {Nickname}" message that would otherwise be posted. Likewise, if the module was solved at the time this command is issued, the processing will be stopped as of that point as well.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.AutoSolve
member.value: Yield return this to indicate automatically solving the module, as if it threw an exception while solving.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.CancelDetonate
member.value: Yield return this to indicate cancelling a previously issued delayed detonation command on the same module.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.WaitingMusic
member.value: Yield return this to indicate playing the waiting music if a command will take long to finish.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.EndWaitingMusic
member.value: Yield return this to indicate stopping the waiting music mid-command.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.ToggleWaitingMusic
member.value: Yield return this to toggle the waiting music on and off mid-command.

member.name: F:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.HideCamera
member.value: Yield return this to hide the heads-up display and cameras while doing quaternion rotations, if it is expected that the camera/hud will get in the way.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.Detonate(System.Nullable{System.Single},System.String)
member.summary: Yield return this to explode the bomb instantly. is specified in number of seconds before the bomb explodes. (Note, sending another detonate command will auto-cancel the previous one on the same module if it hasn't happened already.). is the message to send to chat upon detonation. Both of the parameters are optional.
member.param: The amount of time before the bomb blows up.
The message to send.
member.returns: A formatted string for Twitch Plays.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.SkipTime(System.String)
member.summary: Yield return this to try advancing the clock to the specified time. You must put the full time you wish to skip to, and this time either needs to be less than the current time, if in normal/time mode, or greater than the current time, if in zen mode. Example, if you wanted to set the clock to 5:24, then you do "skiptime 324" or "skiptime 5:24". You can target partway through the seconds, such as "skiptime 45.28", which would then set the clock to 45.28, provided that time has NOT gone by already. You must also set to true, for this function to work.
member.param: The time to skip to in seconds.
member.returns: A formatted string for Twitch Plays.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.AwardPoints(System.Int32)
member.summary: Yield return this to award the user that sent the command points directly, this is currently used for mods like Souvenir to give points to users that answered the questions equally.
member.param: The amount of points to award. Negatives supported.
member.returns: A formatted string for Twitch Plays.

member.name: M:KeepCoding.TPScript`1.AwardPointsOnSolve(System.Int32)
member.summary: Yield return this to award the last user that sent the command points when the module is solved. The module must prevent any user from sending commands afterward in order for Twitch Plays to award points to the correct user. This is currently used by the Twin module when extra points must be given but the module is not solved immediately.
member.param: The amount of points to award. Negatives supported.
member.returns: A formatted string for Twitch Plays.
